{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.05997v1", "title": "Note on the Universality of Parameterized IQP Circuits with Hidden Units
  for Generating Probability Distributions", "summary": "In a series of recent works, an interesting quantum generative model based on
parameterized instantaneous polynomial quantum (IQP) circuits has emerged as
they can be trained efficiently classically using any loss function that
depends only on the expectation values of observables of the model. The model
is proven not to be universal for generating arbitrary distributions, but it is
suspected that marginals can be - much like Boltzmann machines achieve
universality by utilizing hidden (traced-out in quantum jargon) layers. In this
short note, we provide two simple proofs of this fact. The first is
near-trivial and asymptotic, and the second shows universality can be achieved
with a reasonable number of additional qubits.", "main_category": "quant-ph", "categories": "quant-ph", "published": "2025-04-08T13:03:23Z"}
